chargeHist.descr: OWI (5th or 6th w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old)
OWI (5th or 6th w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) and Operating w/ PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Michelle R Salerno was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old), an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Fine and costs are due during term of supervision.  Court further orders 25% of prison wages to be applied toward Court-ordered financial obligations.  If defendant is released with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

Not to possess weapons
 Court orders absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants
    Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed
No contact with any place where primary purposes is the sale or serving of alcohol

Defendant to submit to random testing
  Defendant to participate in drug and/or alcohol counseling and treatment deemed appropriate by DOC and to pay all costs of treatment
Maintain full time employment/schooling
Submit to DNA sample and pay surcharge ($250)
Follow Department's recommended supervision plan

supervisions.notes: Defendant to attend Victim Impact Panel

Defendant Michelle R Salerno in court with attorney Wilfred P. de Junco.  Defendant in custody. Jeffrey A. Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court orders DA to inquire if victim wants to receive the letter and will advise Atty de Junco to forward it.,
Copies given to Public Defenders office and DA's office.  Scanned and forwarded to Branch 3 for review.
Sentencing hearing on September 3, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Michelle R Salerno in court with attorney Wilfred P. de Junco.  Defendant in custody. Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a plea of guilty to count 1.  Count 2 dismissed by the court.  State requests a pre-sentence report and adjourns matter for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 3, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Request from Atty de Junco to move 7/17/14 hearing date up and set for a change of plea. Hearing changed to 7/9/14 at 10:00am

Further proceedings on July 17, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Arraignment on June 10, 2014 at 10:00 am.
